biogHist.abstract: The records held by Tascare, formerly the Tasmanian Society for the Care of Crippled Children, include minutes of meetings, newspaper clippings, annual reports, proceedings of conferences, and material related to an early 1950s survey of 'spastic' children in Tasmania. Although the Society established Wingfield House, the records do not contain the names of any children who stayed there.

list.item: Folder entitled 'Tasmanian Society for the Care of Crippled Children constitution' (1943) - includes a statement about the Society's aims and work.
Minutes of the Fifty-Fourth Annual General Meeting (16 November 1989).
Bound minutes of annual general meetings and meetings of Directors (February 1937-June 1944).
Bound minutes of annual general meetings and meetings of Directors (June 1944-September 1951).
Bound minutes of annual general meetings and meetings of Directors (September 1951-November 1958).

Bound minutes of annual general meetings and meetings of Directors (December 1958-September 1968) - includes minutes of a meeting of representatives from various organisations interested in the welfare of people with disabilities. It was held on 1 August 1968 to establish a State Council.
Proceedings of the 7th Conference of the Australian Advisory Council for the Physically Handicapped (18-22 May 1953).
Proceedings of the 11th Conference of the Australian Advisory Council for the Physically Handicapped, entitled 'Practical Integrated Programme for the 1960s' (24-27 October 1961).

A file dated April 1952 to October 1953 - concerns a survey of the numbers of 'spastic' children in Tasmania in order to work out the best policy for treatment. The file contains letters, newspaper clippings, and a list of children with their ages, addresses, and parents or guardians.
Folder entitled 'SCC Annual Reports' - includes an 'Outline of Policy', 1943.
Folder labelled 'Aspect House' (1977-1981) - contains submissions, minutes of meetings, and documents concerned with fundraising.
Folder labelled 'Amputee Clinic' (1977-1985) - contains children's names for 1977-1978.

A draft history of 36 pages by Geoff Sansom, dated June 1995, and entitled, 'The Tascare Society for Children incorporating the Tasmanian Society for the Care of Crippled Children history, 1935-1995'.

descriptiveNote.p: The records held by Tascare contain a file about Aspect House.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Tasmanian Society for the Care of Crippled Children (1935 - 1988)

descriptiveNote.p: The records held by Tascare contain documents about the Tasmanian Society for the Care of Crippled Children.
